ClientSide.controllers

Class BaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClientSide.controllers.BaseController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client.ClientStatusHandler, Client.MessageReceiveHandler, javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdministratorController, CompanyEmployeeController, CostumerController, CostumerServiceEmployeeController, ServiceSpecialistController, ShopEmployeeController, ShopManagerController

    public abstract class BaseController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, Client.ClientStatusHandler, Client.MessageReceiveHandler
    BaseController: an abstract base class which handling with not desirable disconnection from server and controlling the GUI initialization process. In addition the class contains useful method.
    See Also:
    Initializable, Client.ClientStatusHandler, Client.MessageReceiveHandler

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public final void dispose()
        BaseController dispose methods, should be called on Stage closing sequence.

      • getPressedButton

        protected java.lang.String getPressedButton()
        Returns:
        the pressed button in side bar text that received in getSideButtonsNames(), if never pressed button the method will return null.

      • getSideButtonsNames

        protected abstract java.lang.String[] getSideButtonsNames()
        This method implemented by inherit class, and get the names of the options at the side bar.
        Returns:
        An array of the name of the option at the side bar.

      • initialize

        public final void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                             java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • internalDispose

        protected void internalDispose()
        Event method called when the controller has been disposed. The default implementation does nothing, it may be overridden by extending class.

      • internalInitialize

        protected abstract void internalInitialize()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        The method called when the controller initialized. The default implementation does nothing, it may be overridden by extending class. The method called from exception safe scope.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an exception if the initial stop failed.

      • onClientConnected

        public final void onClientConnected()
        Update the UI after the connection to the server, this method called from exception unsafe scope.
        Specified by:
        onClientConnected in interface Client.ClientStatusHandler

      • onClientDisconnected

        public final void onClientDisconnected()
        Update the UI after the disconnection from the server, this method called from exception unsafe scope.
        Specified by:
        onClientDisconnected in interface Client.ClientStatusHandler

      • onDisconnectFromServer

        protected void onDisconnectFromServer()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Event method called after the connection has been closed due to an method calling or exception. The default implementation does nothing. The default implementation does nothing, it may be overridden by extending class. This method called from exception safe scope.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an exception if the initial stop failed.

      • onReconnectToServer

        protected void onReconnectToServer()
        Event method called after a connection has been established. The default implementation does nothing, it may be overridden by extending class.

      • onSelection

        protected abstract boolean onSelection(java.lang.String title)
        This method invoked when any button pressed in the side bar.
        Parameters:
        title - the name of the selected option, as received in getSideButtonsNames().
        Returns:
        true if the selection approved and false if does not.

      • showAlertMessage

        protected void showAlertMessage(java.lang.String message,
                                javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType alertType)
        The method show alert message from Alert type.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to show.
        alertType - the type of the alert, selected type determinate ton the title and the image.
